text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT SALE - Sri Lanka bought on Thursday night 50,000 tonnes of Canadian wheat for $189.42/tonne C&F for June 16-25 shipment, and 50,000 tonnes of Australian hard wheat for $191.95/tonne C&F for May 27-June 5 shipment.
CORN AND SOYBEAN SALE - State-owned Taiwan Sugar Corp bought a combined shipment of 18,000 tonnes of U.S. corn and 12,000 tonnes of U.S. soybean from Cargill at a tender on Friday, traders said.

WHEAT AND SOYBEAN SALE - A Philippine firm bought 23,000 tonnes of wheat and 7,000 tonnes of U.S. soybeans. Traders said of the 23,000 tonnes of wheat bought late on Thursday, 16,000 was Canadian dark northern spring wheat and 7,000 was U.S. western white wheat. The delivery date was set for August.
The purchase price could not be immediately determined.

SOYBEAN TENDER - South Korea's state-run Agricultural and Fishery Marketing Corp (AFMC) said on Friday it would buy 20,000 tonnes of No.1 soybeans from Continental and another 20,000 tonnes from Tradigrain.
BARLEY TENDERS - Saudi Arabia seeks 700,000 tonnes of feed barley from the world market, European grain traders said.
- The Cyprus Grain Commission seeks 18,000 tonnes of maize, and 25,000 tonnes of barley for June shipment.
- Iran will tender May 19 to import 100,000 tonnes of optional-origin feed barley for shipment in August.
WHEAT TENDER - Iraq seeks 50,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat for July shipment under a United Nations oil-for-food deal. Tender offers were due on May 20.
- Egypt seeks 50,000 tonnes U.S., Australian or French wheat for June 1-14 delivery. Offers were due on May 17.
LENTIL TENDER - Syria offered 16,000 tonnes of lentils for export. May 20 was as the final date to receive bids and with confirmation May 21.

RICE TENDERS - Syria's General Foreign Trade Organisation for Chemicals and Foostuffs issued an international tender to buy 12,000 tonnes of white rice for July shipment. June 4 was the final date to receive bids and confirmation would be made on June 12.
- The state-run Rice Export Corporation of Pakistan on Thursday invited bids by May 26 for the export of 5,000 tonnes of basmati Pak-7 rice containing seven percent broken.
RICE TENDER - Jordan seeks 15,000 tonnes of medium grain camolina type rice on May 21 for June delivery
